Greta Thunberg Fined For Disobeying Pol.content: (File)A Stockholm court fined climate activist Greta Thunberg on Wednesday for disobeying police orders after blocking access to Sweden's parliament during a protest.Asked by the judge why she had not obeyed police orders, she replied: "Because there was a (climate) emergency and there still is.Thunberg has been fined twice before in Sweden, in July and October 2023, for civil disobedience during similar protests.The court said it fined the activist 6,000 Swedish kronor ($551) and ordered her to pay 1,000 kronor in damages and interest.Thunberg denied the charges of two counts of civil disobedience, according to an AFP journalist at the hearing.

On Camera, Bus Driver In US Violently A.content: Watch the video here:Not even being sealed in a plexiglass cage protected this Los Angeles bus driver from being violently attacked by a homeless person.''Not even being sealed in a plexiglass cage protected this Los Angeles bus driver from being violently attacked by a homeless person,'' an X user wrote while sharing the video.The video shows the woman passenger violently grabbing, pulling and punching the bus driver while the latter tried to resist her efforts.A video has surfaced online showing a woman passenger violently attacking a Los Angeles city bus driver after a dispute over fare.The woman then attacked the driver and tried to drag her off the bus from behind her glass safety barrier.

India Got Over $111 Billion In Remittan.content: "With India estimated to have received more than USD 111 billion in 2022, it is by far the largest recipient of international remittances in the world and the first country to ever reach that figure," the report said.India - United Arab Emirates, India - US, India - Saudi Arabia and Bangladesh - India were among the top 10 international country-to-country migration corridors, the report said.The International Organisation for Migration (IOM), in its World Migration Report 2024 launched Tuesday, said that in 2022, India, Mexico, China, the Philippines and France were the top five remittance recipient countries.India became the first country to surpass the USD 100 billion mark in remittances (in 2022)India received over USD 111 billion in remittances in 2022, setting a world record for getting the largest remittances ever recorded, becoming the first country to surpass the USD 100 billion mark, the United Nations migration agency has said.3 per cent of the total population, India is also the origin of the largest number of international migrants in the world, with large diasporas living in countries such as the United Arab Emirates, the United States and Saudi Arabia.

China Zoo Could Not Keep Pandas On Disp.content: With no pandas to put on display for the visitors, a zoo in China dyed two chow chow dogs black and white to pass them off as small pandas.While the zoo saw no harm in the decision and later defended it too, several visitors were reportedly shocked and outraged for being deceived after they saw two fluffy dogs painted black and white in the panda enclosure with a sign that read "panda dogs".To boost attendance during the May Day holiday, Taizhou Zoo, in eastern China, advertised “panda dogs,” which turned out to be Chow Chows whose fur had been dyed black and white.In the video, the two dogs, painted like pandas with the signature splash of black around eyes, can be seen taking a stroll in the enclosure and playing with each other."There are no panda bears at the zoo and we wanted to do this as a result," a zoo spokesperson reportedly said.

Captured 2 More Frontline Villages In U.content: Officials in Ukraine are worried Russia may be preparing a fresh offensive in the north east, taking advantage of severe ammunition shortages in the Ukrainian army.Officials in Ukraine are worried Russia may be preparing a fresh offensive in the north east.(File)Russia said Wednesday it had captured two more frontline villages in Ukraine, including in the north-east Kharkiv region where its troops had been pushed back two years ago.Separately, the Russian defence ministry said it had launched retaliatory strikes against Ukrainian energy and military facilities, after Kyiv reported a wave of aerial attacks overnight.Kyslivka is about 20 kilometres (12 miles) from the embattled Ukrainian stronghold of Kupiansk, while Novokalynove is about 10 kilometres north of Avdiivka, captured by Moscow in February.

Volcano Erupts In Indonesia, Sends Ash.content: Mount Ibu is located on the island of Halmahera in North Maluku provinceA volcano in eastern Indonesia erupted on Wednesday and spewed an ash tower almost a mile into the sky, prompting officials to raise an alert level to the second-highest and warn people to keep away.Mount Ibu, located on the island of Halmahera in North Maluku province, erupted at 11:11 am local time (0211 GMT) and sent a thick column of dark smoke and ash above the peak.Mount Ibu's activity level has been raised from level two to level three" of a four-tiered system, said PVMBG chief Hendra Gunawan in a statement Wednesday.It erupted again last week and remains at the highest alert level of a four-tiered system.Last month, Mount Ruang in North Sulawesi Province erupted more than half a dozen times, forcing thousands of residents of nearby islands to evacuate.

All You Need To Know About US Soldier D.content: (File)US Staff Sergeant Gordon Black was detained on May 2 by police in the Russian far eastern city of Vladivostok on suspicion of stealing from a woman he was in a relationship with.The unnamed Russian woman had been in a relationship with Black after meeting in South Korea, the ministry said.Among the hundreds of often profanity-laced TikTok videos posted by Vashchuk, Radio Free Europe said there were several in which she refers to Black as her "husband" and affectionately as "pindos," a Russian slang word for Americans that roughly translates to "Yankee punk.Radio Free Europe said it had found a TikTok account of Black's romantic partner, Aleksandra Vashchuk, who posted numerous videos of the couple together in South Korea, including at least one showing Black in his U.The local section of Russia's interior ministry said Black was detained at a hotel in the city after a 32-year-old woman made a complaint to police about a theft following an argument.

New Members Of Elite Swiss Guard Sworn.content: Maximilian Fischer, 20, is one of the new recruits to an institution that has been protecting popes since the 16th century - the Swiss Guard.The Swiss Guard was founded by Pope Julius II in 1506."My mum always made these jokes that when I was older, I could go to the Swiss Guards because I was Swiss," Fischer told Reuters.During the swearing in ceremony, the new recruits to the 135-strong force knelt before Pope Francis, raised three fingers on their right hand to represent the Holy Trinity and swore an oath to serve the pontiff to the death.The swearing-in ceremony is held on May 6, commemorating the date in 1527 when 147 Guards were killed defending Pope Clement VII from an attack by the forces of the Holy Roman Emperor Charles V.

UK Teacher Groomed Student For Sex Befo.content: The case is being heard by Manchester Crown Court where the 30-year-old teacher is facing trial on six counts of engaging in sexual activity with a child, including two while in a position of trust."The case was then adjourned to await the rest of the trial, but in the meantime it turned out that Ms Joynes had been in a fairly long-term sexual relationship with another of her 15-year-old pupils," said Mr Allman."According to the BBC, Rebecca Joynes was on bail in connection with grooming a 15-year-old boy by gifting him a 345 pounds (nearly Rs 36,000) designer belt.She was arrested after having sex with the 15-year-old boy, who messaged his friend and even sent a photo clicked secretly."Of course she can't deny that sexual relationship because she became pregnant with (Boy B's) child and she had (Boy B's) child," said Mr Allman.

Brazil Woman Who Wheeled Dead Uncle Int.content: A Brazilian woman who was arrested after wheeling her dead uncle into a bank to take out a loan in his name has finally broken her silence.According to Dailystar, Erika de Souza Vieira Nunes broke down in tears and claimed that she didn't know her uncle was dead, in her first interview since leaving prison.Last month, a security camera in a Rio de Janeiro bank captured her wheeling a dead man into the branch.She further claimed that her uncle told her to hold his head up before they went into the bank.I didn't realise my uncle was dead.

Cannabis To Be Re-Listed As A Narcotic.content: Cannabis was decriminalized for medical use in 2018 and recreational use in 2022 under a previous government, leading to rapid growth of small businesses selling cannabis products, which now number in the tens of thousands.Cannabis was decriminalized for medical use in 2018 in Thailand.(Representational)Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin said on Wednesday that cannabis would be re-listed as a narcotic by end of 2024, in a stunning U-turn for the country two years after it became the first in the region to decriminalise its recreational use."Srettha Thavisin, a property mogul, has voiced his opposition to the recreational use of cannabis since taking office last year, arguing it could exacerbate existing drug abuse problems in Thailand.I want the health ministry to amend the rules and re-list cannabis as a narcotic," Srettha Thavisin said on social media platform X.

US Man Gets 30 Years In Jail For Purpos.content: Through the defendant's own admissions, he had sexual intercourse with 30-50 different men and boys, including a 16-year-old,'' prosecutors said.A 34-year-old man in the US has been imprisoned for at least 30 years for deliberately attempting to spread HIV through sexual contact.According to CBS News, Alexander Louie admitted to having sex with 30 to 50 different men and boys, including a 16-year-old.The investigation in the case started last August after Louie began ''an online sexual conversation" with someone he believed to be a 15-year-old boy, but it actually was an undercover detective.Louie, who is HIV positive, was not taking his medication, and purposely having sexual contact with both men and teenage boys in hopes to transfer HIV to them.

Bread Packets Recalled After Rat Body P.content: (Representational)More than 100,000 packets of sliced bread have been recalled in Japan after parts of a black rat's body were discovered inside two of them, the manufacturer said Wednesday.Around 104,000 packs of the bread have been recalled in mainland Japan, from Tokyo to the northern Aomori region.Then on Wednesday, Pasco confirmed that parts of a black rat had contaminated the two packs.Cleanness and hygiene are taken seriously in Japan, but food poisonings and recalls occasionally make headlines.Food recalls are rare in Japan, a country with famously high standards of sanitation, and Pasco Shikishima Corporation said it was investigating how the rodent remains had crept in to its products.

Boeing Cargo Plane Lands Without Front.content: (Representationall)A FedEx Airlines Boeing cargo plane landed at Istanbul Airport on Wednesday without its front landing gear deployed and managed to stay on the runway, Turkey's transport ministry said, adding that there were no casualties.The runway where the cargo plane landed has been temporarily closed to air traffic, but traffic on the other runways at the airport was continuing without any interruption, the airport operator IGA said.Runway where the cargo plane landed has been temporarily closed to air traffic.Video footage obtained from Reuters showed sparks flying and smoke billowing as the front end of the plane scraped along the runway before being doused with firefighting foam.The Boeing 767 aircraft, flying from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport, informed the traffic control tower at Istanbul Airport that its landing gear failed to open and it landed with guidance from the tower, the ministry said in its statement.

Video: Boeing Cargo Plane Crashes On Is.content: Watch the video here:A cargo plane touched down at Istanbul Airport without its nose gear—the landing gear didn't deploy when it should have.The runway where the cargo plane landed has been temporarily closed to air traffic, but traffic on the other runways at the airport was continuing without any interruption, the airport operator IGA said.IGA Istanbul Airport Rescue and ARFF continues its efforts to move the aircraft to a safe area and open the runway to flight traffic.Istanbul Airport operator IGA said: "The accident was taken under control without any loss of life with the immediate intervention of the İGA Istanbul Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting team (ARFF), which was ready on the runway before the controlled landing on the fuselage.The video shared on X shows the plane attempting an emergency landing, smashing down into the runway and scraping its nose along the concrete.
